name: GuestHouse Inn & Suites

reviews.text: I have been staying in this hotel for nearly two weeks and have one more to go while on business here in Monroe, Washington. Everything about this hotel is great with the exception of the location.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Service ... Needs A Better Location

reviews.text: First, the hotel itself is in great shape and the maintenance staff keeps it that way. A few days ago, a little bit of the caulk started to peel up in the shower. When I got back from one long day at work, I was greeted in my room with a letter of apology from the hotel manager, an explanation of what had happened and how it had been fixed (new caulk). I was even offered a new room if the caulk repair didn't meet with my satisfaction. Wow ... it has been a long time since I've seen a hotel manager pay that much attention to the details.
reviews.title: Never Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is some of the friendliest around. I leave nearly every morning with someone at the front desk telling me to "have a good day" or returning to a nice "good evening".
reviews.title: Poor Reception & Noisy Hotel Building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only drawback is the location of the hotel. Several times a night the local freight train rumbles through town and, although it is on the other side of Hwy 2 and is probably 1000 feet away, its horn and rumble are loud enough to wake me up almost every time it goes by. But the hotel is centrally located in the middle of a great area of restaurants, retail stores, grocery stores, etc. You can walk to almost anything you need and it seems relatively safe.
reviews.title: Acceptable; not fancy, but certainly not bad.

reviews.text: I am very happy and would stay here anytime I return to Monroe, Washington.
reviews.title: Good hotel, convenient location

reviews.text: The rooms were clean. The front desk was fine. It is perfectly adequate for basic lodging.
reviews.title: Wholly mediocre lodging

reviews.text: The internet SUCKED. Sporadically froze for several minutes at a time. TV service SUCKED. Nice flat panel TV's but very few channels and crappy signal and picture. Breakfast was typical fare. Better than nothing. I had to stay here for two weeks for work. The internet thing drove me nuts.
reviews.title: Never Again!

reviews.text: My 83 year old mother placed reservations for 5 rooms for a family event of hot air ballooning in nearby Snohomish,at dawn the following morning. This was to be a gift trip from her, to the family. In the morning of the reservation date, the balloon company called to cancel the flight planned for that next day, due to weather. I immediately contacted this hotel explaining the situation and advised them we would definitely plan to book with them when this was rescheduled, and was told they would most likely be able to work with us since this was a situation out of our control. The desk clerk and manager were very pleasant. The owner, Myungsook Shin, however, was less than understanding and charged her full boat for 3 of the 5 rooms reserved because our cancellation was not a full 24 hr prior to checkin! This was NOT during their peak season when the State Fair is held in that area.
reviews.title: Outstanding Staff!!

reviews.text: With Mom being on a fixed income, I did not let her absorb this loss, and I paid, but you can bet your booties that establishment will not get another dime from this family! I would not recommend this facility to anyone.!
reviews.title: Messed up my reservation and charged me for their mistake
No complaints at all
reviews.text: Members of my daughter's soccer team recently enjoyed a four-night stay at the Guesthouse Inn. The property was attractive, extremely clean, conveniently located next to fast-food, chain and other restaurants, Fred Meyer, and the Galaxy 12 movie theater -- all within walking distance (1-2 blocks).

description: Established in 2006. In 1999 the Holiday Inn Express opened a brand new building in Monroe WA. In the summer of 2006 the hotel was sold and became Guesthouse International Inn & Suites. We are a small hotel with only 66 rooms and we are the only hotel in town with an indoor pool, to the delight of our guests.
